summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingThis multitasker does it all. Cécred Moisture Sealing Lotion seals, smooths, and styles with a light hold, while fighting frizz. Hair is left shiny and polished, and curls look more enhanced and defined.
details: DetailsBenefitsReduces split endsSeals cuticles and fills in microcavitiesFights frizzKeeps styles lasting longerEnhances and defines curlsLeaves hair touchably soft, smooth, and shinyFor all hair types and texturesFor those experiencing frizz, dullness, reversionFor those seeking curl definition or style longevitySafe for human hair wigs and weavesKey IngredientsPhyto-Seal Complex - Smooths the hair cuticle and fills microcavitiesAfrican Oil Blend - Luscious trifecta of baobab, moringa, and black seed oils supports elasticity and elevates the shinePhyto-Collagen Complex - Features botanically derived collagen proteins from tremella, hibiscus, and marine algae goldrella extracts to improve hair elasticity and deliver moisture-rich nutrientsHyssop Extract - Known as a sacred herb that aids wellness and balance, this North African plant is rich in antioxidants to support hair health and radianceSignature Fragrance - Rich and complex, Temple Oud has notes of oud, Australian sandalwood, warm musk, night-blooming jasmine, Haitian vetiver, and violet leavesFormulated without silicones, SLS/SLES, phthalates, and parabensResearch ResultsReduces split ends by 92%*Fights frizz through 24 hours of high-humidity exposure**Tested in a 3rd party clinical laboratory using hair tressesItem 2636918How To UseWorks well on damp or dry hair. A little goes a long way. Apply sparingly.Apply to towel-dried hair to seal in moisture and add light hold to air-dried styles.Apply along with a heat protectant before heat styling.IngredientsWater/Aqua/Eau, Glycerin, Cetearyl Alcohol, Hydrogenated Ethylhexyl Olivate, Behentrimonium Chloride, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Glyceryl Stearate, Glycol Stearate, Lactobacillus/Honey/Keratin Ferment, Hydrogenated Olive Oil Unsaponifiables, Hydroxypropyl Bis-Hydroxyethyldimonium Chloride, Polyquaternium- 4, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Extract, C9-12 Alkane, Squalane, Argania Spinosa Kernel Oil, Adansonia Digitata (Baobab) Seed Oil, Nigella Sativa Seed Oil, Citrullus Lanatus (Watermelon) Seed Oil, Moringa Oleifera Seed Oil, Boswellia Carterii (Frankincense) Oil, Hyssopus Officinalis (Hyssop) Extract, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Hibiscus Rosa-Sinensis Flower Extract, Chlorella Ferment, Tremella Fuciformis Polysaccharide, Panthenol, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Sodium Laneth-40 Maleate/Styrene Sulfonate Copolymer, Fragrance (Parfum), Caramel, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol, Pentylene Glycol, Benzyl Alcohol, Potassium Sorbate, Disodium Phosphate, Sodium Phosphate, Polysorbate 60, Alcohol, Linalool, Limonene, Coumarin, Citronellol, Alpha-Isomethyl IononeShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Works well on damp or dry hair. A little goes a long way. Apply sparingly.Apply to towel-dried hair to seal in moisture and add light hold to air-dried styles.Apply along with a heat protectant before heat styling.

reviews.headline: Beyonce did her thing
reviews.comments: The product provides moisture and operates like a heat protectant as well. Gives the hair a lot of shine and glow. Great product. I would definitely purchase again.

reviews.headline: A little goes a long way
reviews.comments: I received a sample of this product had it for months one day I decided to give it a try I'm still kicking myself best decision ever. I read a few reviews on how to best use this and I it says a little goes a long way so I used a pea size after parting my hair in four sections use from roots to tips and definitely covered beautifully didn't reapply for two weeks kept the moisture in along with the oil chefs kiss!

reviews.headline: It Really does it
reviews.comments: This I use as a leave in especially on day 2 or 3 refresh with some moisture a little cream and it helps detangle and refresh any frizz it tames I love the sandalwood scent I know that tru sandalwood essence can make some people say wood chip comment lol I technically dont use it as a leave in but i really like it i was using oribes supershine for this same thing but its a toss up now its that good for me it tames detangles easier cuts frizz and smells good

reviews.headline: Smells good but returning
reviews.comments: The product seems good but it didnt make my curls any better looking than they already are. I also tried using this oroductt to straighten my hair with…absolutely not!!! It weigjed my hair down so much even with using a small amount.

reviews.headline: Believe the hype!
reviews.comments: I have very kinky hair and I was worried this leave in wouldn't be "heavy" enough for my hair to actually feel moisturized but it left my hair very light, soft, and feeling moisturized. It also pairs nicely with my go to gels.

reviews.headline: This Moisture Sealing Lotion is THAT GIRL ✨
reviews.comments: At first, I was a little unsure on how to use this lotion because I KNOW I cannot just use one product as my styler. So I used the same styling products I normally use and then put this sealing lotion on top. GIRL! When I tell you my hair was defined and MOIST for DAYS. Even after days when I didn't go anywhere or take my bonnet off lol. My hair still remained moist and only needed slight refreshing to go out. Another notable point for me is that the front of my hair NEVER curls. It's been flat and limp for years, but not with this. My exhausted front curls were well-rested. I started with a free sample size and had to upgrade to the full size.  The scent is not overbearing, but I do enjoy it. I did a complete demonstration & review of the product line on my 3C/4A high density, high porosity hair. I tried to include the link but it won't allow me: Search "Cècred by Beyonce Demo & Review 3C Natural Hair Wash N' Go" if interested. May all of your curls be plump, defined, and voluminous ;)

reviews.headline: The smell is really strong
reviews.comments: If you are sensitive to scents do not get this. It works well but its strong it gave me a headache.

reviews.headline: Works well but the scent is a no.
reviews.comments: I received a sample of fhis with an order. It works well in my long, blonde, medium thicnkess hair. It feels light weight and makes my hair smooth. However, it smells like the wood chips you put in a hamster cage. I would not purchase it because of the scent.

reviews.headline: New favorite moisture lotion!
reviews.comments: This is hands down my favorite hair moisturizer now! It prevents breakage and seals in moisture without creating heaviness. It has taken me awhile to find a hair lotion that does both and this is a must buy!

reviews.headline: Best lotion on the market
reviews.comments: The texture of this lotion is spot on.  It's not greasy but it's light and heavy enough to get the job done. I use it with my LOC method and it works perfectly.

reviews.headline: I love this
reviews.comments: I have 4A/B medium porosity hair and this product does wonders. It's made my hair styling routine just one product and I can confidently ensure my hair will feel moisturized until my next wash.

reviews.headline: Not the best. Not the worst.
reviews.comments: I have "type 4", medium-high density, high porosity hair that I wear in a variety of styles (Afro, blowout, flat twists, mini twists, "protective" styles with added hair *never a wash and go- sorry y'all lol). This didn't work as a leave-in for me. It detangles okay and it's thick but it didn't moisturize my hair like I needed it to when I used it by itself. It's true what they say- you don't need to use much of this product. If you are using the correct amount the price seems more reasonable. I've been using it OVER my leave-in when I use my revair for a blowout, and then a little bit after blowdrying mixed with a few drops of oil (not the cecred oil) to help seal in moisture and I think it has helped prevent my hair from reverting as much which is nice! My hair has been noticably more moisturized after blowdrying when I use this. I think this is a nice product for heat styled hair but not for natural styles, from my experience. My TGIN green tea leave-in is still holy grail (moisturizes for any style, softens, &  detangles like a dream) -I'll keep experimenting with the bottle I have but I probably won't repurchase this. I love the smell though!

reviews.headline: Love for coarse, thick wavy hair
reviews.comments: Okay so at first I was using this like a curl cream - which was waaaaaay too much product (though my hair was smooth) I watched a video and this was described as a leave in conditioner- once i used way less as a leave in before a styling product and WOW... my hair looks so great. I even went and bought the treatment mask bc i have been loving the lotion so much

reviews.headline: Beyoncé I love you girl
reviews.comments:
Smells amazing 
Put this on my hair to see if it works and my hair LOVES IT SO MUCH. Getting these curly back to normal

reviews.headline: Beyoncé I love you girl.
reviews.comments: The smell is amazing. And it works amazingly. I pit this on my hair and my hair said baby we love you

reviews.headline: Good For All Hair types
reviews.comments: I bought this because of recommendation from my ulta stylist i got to. As someone with wavy, dry hair this does wonders for me. I also use it on my son who has curly hair and ive seen an improvement as well.

reviews.headline: Best product to bring out my curls yet!
reviews.comments: I am in LOVE…

reviews.headline: Grew to Like It
reviews.comments: This has happened with a few products (most their deep conditioner) where I hated it at first and then grew to love it. I think this product is too thick for my fine hair (like the DC) but the ingredients are so good for my hair, my hair just thrives with it. I was skeptical before about using this as my hair didn't "feel" moisturized but now I respect it so much more as a blowout primer. And honestly I think that's the mistake Cecred made with this. I think sealing lotion is not a good name. I expected a lighter texture for a lotion and there are no film formers so the sealing part felt like a miss. I think naming it "blowout primer" would have set expectations better and helped people understand how to use this. Also, Cecred products are concentrated, and that's especially true of the moisture sealing lotion. I feel like that's not obvious when you start using the brand. So yes, now that I understand how to use the product and what to expect from it, it's still thicker than I would like but I love it now. I returned it initially and then went back and repurchased it. I wish she would come out with a lighter version of this for the fine textured girlies but yea, it's a win to me now.

reviews.headline: Yeah. I'll get it again.
reviews.comments: I have fine/ high porosity hair: 4 b/c it was very hydrating and the scent is amazing. A little can go a long way for me so im not to aggy about the price. I also use it in my silk press routine.

reviews.headline: Not impressed
reviews.comments: I returned

faceoff_positive.comments: This has happened with a few products (most their deep conditioner) where I hated it at first and then grew to love it. I think this product is too thick for my fine hair (like the DC) but the ingredients are so good for my hair, my hair just thrives with it. I was skeptical before about using this as my hair didn't "feel" moisturized but now I respect it so much more as a blowout primer. And honestly I think that's the mistake Cecred made with this. I think sealing lotion is not a good name. I expected a lighter texture for a lotion and there are no film formers so the sealing part felt like a miss. I think naming it "blowout primer" would have set expectations better and helped people understand how to use this. Also, Cecred products are concentrated, and that's especially true of the moisture sealing lotion. I feel like that's not obvious when you start using the brand. So yes, now that I understand how to use the product and what to expect from it, it's still thicker than I would like but I love it now. I returned it initially and then went back and repurchased it. I wish she would come out with a lighter version of this for the fine textured girlies but yea, it's a win to me now.
faceoff_positive.headline: Grew to Like It

faceoff_negative.comments: I bought the shampoo/conditioner trial trio. The scrub shampoo really cleans my scalp, five stars for that. I bought this lotion separately. I used it on my wet/damp hair right out the shower. It smells really, really good from the shampoo, the conditioner and the lotion! 5 stars for the smell. It doesn't have any hold, however, so remove a start for that. I used it this morning on dry hair and it was efficient for taming the scraggly fly-aways. I am Afro -Latina. I have 2C curls at the nape of my neck, 3a/3b throughout and some 4a curls in wide strips at my temples and by my ears. I also have some 2c patterns sprinkled in on the crown. The hair product line says that it is inclusive to all hair types but I think Beyonce forgot about the mixed girls or the ones with European or Indigenous heritages in their lineage. I hope she comes out with a styling gel with medium/firm hold. I must also take away a star for the lack of help with definition, unless I am not misunderstanding what the function of this lotion is. It may also not be for my type of hair. I have to find some way to tame those wispy 2c flyaways. I will probably use the scrub shampoo several days a week for a good cleanse to break down buildup. I will probably also use the conditioner every now and again but I think I will keep the lotion for the days I am on vacation at the beach as a treatment for the saltwater damage to my hair. The rest of the products and oils will probably be too heavy for my hair. I will continue to use my DevaCurl and Innersense cleansing and styling products. Please come out with some styling products for the Beckys with the good hair.
faceoff_negative.headline: Mixed feelings
